reviews.title: Beautiful location & wonderful service

likes.disliked: — Nothing (maybe a bit on food prices!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: different place, physically, mentally and spiritually. Gone are the crowds and the hassles of normal day life, here is the peace and serenity that makes a place so special.
reviews.title: Once in a lifetime experience.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've described many places as having a warm welcome but Four Season Sayan takes it to a whole new level. From every person we saw it was a beautiful, truly
reviews.title: hard to beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: heartfelt welcome. Of all the places I visited in the world, Four Seasons Sayan knows the art of making a person feel welcome. It simply and easily just comes from their heart.
reviews.title: $ecluded Relaxation But...

likes.liked: — Beautiful rooms and great breakfast at the Terrace Restaraunt
likes.disliked: — Service and overall value of the stay

reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed in various resorts in Bali. When we came to FS Sayan, we found the location and the architecture very impressive. But, our villa looked tired inside. And, there were spider webs hanging down from the ceiling in our bathroom and sitting area. Our outdoor lounge chairs were so dirty that we did not want to use them. The in-room internet service did not work. We asked for assistance but still could not fix it.
reviews.title: Good but not Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we had come from the airport right to this hotel at the start of our Bali trip, I would be writing a much different review. However, after six days at Amankila on the coast, we had a more conservative view of Bali luxury, and this property was sort of too tricked out for us.
reviews.title: Not as wonderful as Amandari

likes.disliked: — Too tricked-out; too big; poor room selection

reviews.text: In addition, we failed to see why the Four Seasons (which we have frequented at many locations in Europe over the years) would ask us if we had any special events that formed a basis for our visit when we made the reservation, and would then ignore it. We told the hotel it was a significant birthday for my wife, and our 20th anniversary that led to our trip. On arrival, we were shown to a pretty basic suite, that wasn't in a great location, and our apparent acknowledgement of our special circumstances were some rose petals sprinkled in a bathtub. We asked to see a nicer suite, and we were shown to a wonderful riverview room, but they insisted on a higher payment for it, despite our long history with the company and our reservation information. The same thing happened at the Four Seasons Singapore, at the end of our trip-they didn't even acknowledge our circumstances, let alone that we were dedicated prior customers of the chain.
reviews.title: Beauty and tranquility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In any event, after dinner at Amandari, that property offered us an upgrade to a pool suite at less cost than the Four Seasons room, and at a much nicer property. Rather than a tricked-out somewhat artificial "farm" experience at Four Seasons, we had a real village farm right outside our suite, with trails and walks down to the river, and the highest level of personal attention one could ever ask for. We went from a hundred or more rooms on the property to one of just 20 to 30. So we left after one night at Sayan, and spent our next six days, and all of our dough, at Amandari.
reviews.title: Needs some polish, just not the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can check out our reviews of Amandari and Amankila elsewhere on Trip Advisor. We didn't regret our move for one second. We have a full photo blog link of our time on Bali on the Amankila posting.
reviews.title: Great architecture, spectacular location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent three nights here in August at the end of a business trip through Asia and only have gushing compliments for this place. I was a bit apprehensive given some of the negative comments I read here but can't imagine they stayed at the same resort. From the moment you arrive, you're transported to this other world of peace and tranquility.
reviews.title: 2 nights in paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in many other luxury (5+ star) resorts around the world including Vanuatu, Tahiti, Hawaii, Australia (Noosa, Hayman Island, etc), I have to rate this on par with some of the world's best in terms of service.
reviews.title: Service Excellence

likes.disliked: — Stairs...there are a lot of them!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negatives exhibited by some others here are all easily addressed if you speak to someone. For example, if you don't like your villa, ask to be moved and your issues will be resolved if there is availability. We made sure that our special requirements were communicated ahead of time and checked that the communication got through despite our travel agents confirming them. Moral of the story is - if its special, you make sure the job is done right.
reviews.title: beautiful , just lovely!!!
Nice
reviews.text: The Good: Service (exemplary) - they remember your name even if you call them several days after you have checked out!!!, architecture/scenery (lush green like you are in a forest), remoteness (doesn't get quieter/more remote than this in a luxury resort in Bali), in-room cleanliness (no dust even on the mosquito nets!!! and no geckos got into our room - that is an achievement in itself if you know Bali), room facilities (love the large bathroom), hotel facilities including bar and restaurant - the food is some of the best in Bali which you can experience in a hotel/resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bad: Buggy wait times can vary depending on how busy they are, Spa experience isn't the best but still acceptable, restaurant service can fluctuate (they took away our forks when there was still a plate of danish pastry sitting there expecting us to eat with our fingers I guess).
reviews.title: A really Amazing Hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the bad wasn't enough for us to say we won't be returning to this place. In fact, we plan to come back here whenever Ubud is on our travel agenda.
reviews.title: Perfect!
